Reviews.Title: “Great Hospitality”
Reviews.Author: Travelwithme2day
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Radission and I was pleasantly surprised by the service. Really nice renovated rooms and lobby. The front desk staff are excellent service providers. My checking with Amanda was top notch and when I needed assistance with my luggage she came around and assisted me. I was in need of some entertainment and she informed me of LA Live. Excellent place to grab a drink at The Yard House. I will be coming back!

Reviews.Title: “Well positioned hotel for Downtown LA”
Reviews.Author: MikeGB2
Reviews.Content: Great position for proximity to LA, as well as USC, but sometimes as was the case when I was there, that means that parking for a guest is impossible. There was a USC & UCLA game on when I got back to the hotel, and the parking lot behind the hotel was full of visitors and they sent me around to another parking block which I couldn't get into either. After around 30 minutes of trying, eventually I was let into the original block and luckily found a space. Very frustrating as they knew I was paying for parking at the hotel and should have reserved a space for me. Otherwise the hotel is OK, although the elevators need updating. The service was OK as well, except in the bar, where it was non existent. I actually was going to eat there, but when I had to call the bar tender over as he was busy chatting to a customer and totally ignored me, I quickly changed my mind. The bar was empty except for the other customer and myself by the way. I would recommend the bar next door where the service was great, food was good and is very popular. Don't eat in the hotel if you can help it.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded My Expectations!”
Reviews.Author: SuzyNewtown
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in some very fine hotels around the USA and the world. I am giving this Radisson an Excellent rating because it is excellent for what it is - a moderately priced hotel. Though it has been here for years (and years), it has recently been completely refurbished. There's a unified decoratiing theme, low-key natural colors, leaf images, etc. The furniture is unoffensively modern. They did a good job considering they were working with an old hotel. There are nice robes in the closet and granite in the very clean bathroom. The bed was comfortable and also tastefully decorated with a white comforter. The front desk personnel were helpful and friendly. The restaurant next door, part of the hotel, "McCays" served a delicious breakfast - large portions, beautifully arranged on the plate, delicious,good service. I was so surprised to find a hotel restaurant at this location with this level of food! The lunch and dinner menus looked equally tempting. The hotel is adjacent to the University. A branch of the USC Bookstore is located off the lobby, making it convenient to purchase a gift for your kid or yourself. I was expecting average/bland... maybe worse, but what I found was... excellent. If you need to visit USC, why bother with going back and forth on the freeways? Stay on campus at the Radisson. It is excellent for "OK". I hope that makes sense to you :)

Reviews.Title: “Improved Radisson”
Reviews.Author: heidiwm
Reviews.Content: Came here 2 years for a campus tour and it was in need of updating. Been here about 4 times since then. I was very surprised that USC had not put more pressure on the chain to remodel, as it is the only hotel close to USC. The hotel was charging $250/night for move in week which was ridiculous for the hotel quality. The staff was always very friendly though. They have recently renovated at least some of the floors and it is MUCH better. Rooms are very nice- only a slight issue with the drains. Convenient, reasonably priced restaurant attached next door that is great for lunches and dinner and it is very comfortable with a modern atmosphere. Overall a much more positive experience now and I would recommend overnighting there.

Reviews.Title: “needs work”
Reviews.Author: ToniPaterson
Reviews.Content: We are staying here now as we move our daughter into USC housing. The room's air conditioner is very loud- we turn it off just to talk, which means that it will be a warm night- but it is quite late so we are too tired to move. Topper was calling for room service breakfast and being told we had to fill out a doorknob order form (none on the door). So we called the front desk and was told to come down and get one. Seriously.

Reviews.Title: “How employees make the difference!”
Reviews.Author: USCMOM50
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Radisson Midtown at USC and was pleasantly surprised at the level of hospitality I received during my stay. This hotel is located directly across from the USC campus, so we didn't have to park on campus, we just walked across the street! We had issues with the water temperature and drainage but once we brought it to the attention of the front desk, Jenna apologized and along with Daniel the front desk manager, made our experience a positive one. They are true professionals who know how to respond to all guest concerns. We will continue to book at this hotel and would recommend this hotel to USC parents and family!

Reviews.Title: “Ok place to stay, but not recommended for those who want a quiet atmosphere.”
Reviews.Author: Xtela
Reviews.Content: My fiancee and I stayed here for a weekend with our toddler, because it was close to the house of the people we came out here to visit. Unfortunately we didn't take into consideration that some college students live here. On the Saturday night that we were here, we were awakened several times during the night by doors slamming, laughing and carrying on in the hallway, and other noises made by people having a good time. The hotel doors also have knockers on them, and we heard a lot of obnoxious knocking on the doors on our floor at all hours of the night. Not a great atmosphere for a family trying to sleep. However, room was clean and comfortable. Shower/tub combo is a little awkward as it sits about a foot off of the ground. Ok place for people who aren't traveling with young children and don't mind the noise. Price was reasonable

Reviews.Title: “A fairly good university hotel”
Reviews.Author: Edward-A A
Reviews.Content: It is one of the convenient and high-quality hotels if you would like to visit USC within walking distance. All in all, reasonable service with reasonable hotel rate. Since I only stay in this hotel for one day (actually, with just about 15 hours) and with majority of time visiting my friends in USC, I do not have any complaint about this hotel at all.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place for Visiting USC”
Reviews.Author: Utahk
Reviews.Content: This hotel is run by USC and is right across the street from campus. Although we had concerns about staying in "downtown LA", this is a great location for assessing the neighborhood and having a stress-free place to stay while visiting the campus. Because of our Club Carlson membership, we asked for and got a room upgrade. Our room had recently been redecorated and it was very chic. We also liked that it access through a sliding door to the patio and pool area. We didn't have time to lounge at the pool, but I got in an early morning swim workout. The pool is not a full lap pool, but is better than most hotel pools for lap swimming. The adjacent restaurant also was incredibly quick when we need a fast breakfast before touring campus. Parking was also very convenient. I'd stay there next time, without a doubt!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Staff - Shabby and Dated Facility”
Reviews.Author: sail12247
Reviews.Content: Stayed because all other downtown & airport hotels full for convention. Positives: (1) The desk, restaurant, and housekeeping staff all helpful, cheerful, and very pleasant except doorman who upon being asked for cab pointed outside and said I would find one (only doorman I ever met who did not want to earn a tip by helping out with bags or cab). (2) Beds are comfortable. (3) Food in restaurant ok though room is dark. Negatives: Hotel is dated and dark 1970's drab brown and beige with little lighting. Clean but shabby in lobby and on "Executive" floor to which I was assigned. Alas, the advertised "Executive Lounge" on the floor was unavailable because it was rented out to some construction company as field office. The electronic keys did not work and required one to repeat insert process 10-20 times each time one entered room. Room was drab, clean, smelled slightly of a stale locker room, with "Sleep Comfort Bed", flat screen TV, and old floral paintings. Bathroom is small with standard amenities and odd shower curtain that barely reached tub rim and therefore leaky. Staff advised that six floors were used as USC dorm until this Spring - maybe why lobby and elevators look so beaten up. Gym is adequate although TVs on treadmills broken. Overall: Hotel needs to be renovated and room rates lowered until then. Probably ok for visiting USC and one night stay for a tired traveler, but not one I would recommend to anyone looking for a nice stay at a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Awful! Never again...”
Reviews.Author: bchgrrrl
Reviews.Content: Stayed here during Microsoft WPC 2011. Consistently disappointed..everything from daily room construction - of which we were neither notified at time of reservation, or time of check in. Incredibly disruptive and inconvenient when trying to manage work/business from the hotel room. Room service was a joke - one instance being told they were busy and could they call me back, one occasion of being sent to voice mail, and the third occasion was being sent to voice mail and being notified the voice mail was full! Desk staff was friendly, but rooms were outdated, had stained & rippling carpet, showers inappropriate for anyone over 5'. Would neither return or recommend to any friends or family coming to do downtown business or any USC sports/activities.

Reviews.Title: “Close to USC-some good some bad”
Reviews.Author: stepford wife
Reviews.Content: This hotel is literally across the street from USC so for parents weekend or graduation then you are all set. The outside staff is terrific. Very welcoming and suggested great placed to eat. Their help with a car etc was invaluable as I was in a rush to the airport. The inside staff not so great. Not welcoming, disorganized and somewhat rude was my experience. I reserved two rooms since I have four children, they put the rooms far apart and then said they couldn't change them. They fixed it after an unpleasant discussion. They did not put us close to the elevator which we request each time. Generally they acted like why are you here and can you just take your keys and go away. I would stay here again just make sure your needs are expressed up front and stand your ground.

Reviews.Title: “Fine hotel, close to USC”
Reviews.Author: AvocadoInParadise
Reviews.Content: As the only decent hotel within walking distance of USC campus, it is perfectly fine. It is directly across the street from one of the "gate" entrances to campus and I easily walked back and forth from the hotel to campus many times. I even walked over there and around the campus in the evening, and felt fine even though bordering the campus is supposed to be not the best neighborhood of LA. If you have to be at USC for something, this is by far your best bet. LA's heavy traffic and poor public transportation make it difficult to stay in a different hotel. There are several restaurants along the Northern edge of campus and up Figuroa Street a few blocks, within a 10-15 minute walk from the hotel. The hotel also has a restaurant/bar adjacent to it, but I did not try it since I did not know it was there until leaving. It does not have an obvious sign and is halfway up the driveway to the parking garage. There was complimentary coffee and tea set out in the hotel lobby in the mornings. There was free wifi in the lobby, and the outdoor pool was fenced in from the street and nice. The car parking setup was good if you drive to the hotel. The front desk gives a pass that you put in your car, billed to your room, so you can park in the campus garage located right behind the hotel. You can come and go as needed from the garage while staying there.

Reviews.Title: “Radisson and USC do not mix well.”
Reviews.Author: PorkmanDelardo
Reviews.Content: The fact that this hotel is across the street from USC campus and walking distance to the Coliseum, is the only reason it is still in business. Requested a call when room was ready and never got a call back. Room key cards would not open electronic lock. Guest across the way said,"just swipe it about 20 times or so." It worked? Had 2 rooms and key refused to work for second room too. Had to go back downstairs to get key programmed, again? Everything about the rooms is old , worn or dated. TV reception is fair to poor. Bathrooms rough on the edges, although clean. Yes, hair dryer mount was missing, tub is raised a foot from ground level, awkward. AC unit is ancient. Room service menu is limited. McKays restaurant is next door and like everything else, run by student workers who try to do what they can to serve you but, service is still lacking. Server was very unprofessional and rude. Sharing lobby and elevators with students is no big deal except when students are running around barefoot, skateboards in tow, and short-shorts, gabbing on cell phones, etc. Hey its a dorm, remember? There are no other amenities that go along with this hotel. except pool. Will avoid the Radisson USC Dorm and Hotel in the future and you should too.

Reviews.Title: “Possibly the worst hotel Ive stayed in!”
Reviews.Author: Rewardspoints
Reviews.Content: We selected this hotel due to its cheaper cost, trusting the Radisson name. On arrival, there were roadworks going on outside the front of the hotel, the freeway to the back was extremely noisey and to top it off, the hotel is used for student accomodation for the university across the road. We therefore had to put up with noise from the students partying all weekend. Taxis were available outside the hotel and the cost to Hollywood, Universal etc. was approx. $45. The food from room service was poor and the service from the hotel staff poor too. Our room wasnt serviced, although the cleaner said it was and after the front desk staff checking and confirming it hadnt been cleaned, all they could offer us was a few clean towels. The hotel also advertised a gym but this was a really poor leisure room. There are no bars or restaurants close by with the exception of McKays next door that is only open 1000-2200 (if you're lucky) and The Lab thats full of students and still closes at 10pm. My advice - pay a little more and stay in a much better hotel. Its the pits!

Reviews.Title: “Good Experience For What You Pay”
Reviews.Author: LoDay
Reviews.Content: Date Of Trip: July 14th - 21st 2010 Number Of Guests: 3 (Age 20) 2 of my friends and myself stayed at this hotel during a recent trip to LA. The main reason we decided to stay here was because the cost was a lot lower than other hotels in the surrounding area, and we trusted the Radisson name to have certain standards. After reading the online reviews we had some hesitations, but overall our experience was fairly positive. When we entered the hotel we were greeted by friendly staff members (during our stay the front desk staff also assisted us with information about local attractions and shopping). It was clear that the lobby had been recently renovated and it was very modern and clean. When we arrived in our room we had just a few small problems. The safe was originally not working, but after we called the front desk someone did come up quickly to repair it. We also had an issue with our air conditioner leaking onto the floor (but did not notice it until the last couple of days and did not bother to report it to the staff members). The overall feel for the room was nice. Our room was always cleaned well, and the level we were on was very quiet. The bathroom area would be the only area for complaint. While spacious, the ceilings were cracked and peeling and the bathtub was in need of repairs. WARNING: if you are about to stay in the hotel, exit the bathtub with extreme caution. It is raised well above the floor and will result in you falling and slipping if you are not careful (I am speaking from the experience of my friend who did fall). Aside from the hotel room itself, the hotel featured a lovely pool area (that we witnessed being cleaned daily), and fitness center (that was being upgraded, but still useable). The hotel also featured a “business center", which was literally one computer just past the front desk that had very poor connections to the internet, if you could get it to connect at all. The lack of access to the internet was the main disappointment with the hotel. Another disappointment was about parking. We knew that parking was an extra fee daily, but what we did not expect was to have a parking ticket on our car due to our permit being "improperly displayed". This was an issue of the USC Parking Staff, who were very rude and unreasonable when we went to go discuss our ticket with them. On the plus side, the restaurant located beside the hotel was perfect for a fast, delicious and affordable lunch. We went multiple times during our stay. The location of the hotel was also close to the highway, and located central to most of our attractions. -Again, we chose this hotel mainly for the price and were satisfied for the service and quality received based on the price.

Reviews.Title: “THIS PLACE IS TERRIBLE......STAY AWAY !!!!”
Reviews.Author: Justtryingtorelax84
Reviews.Content: No Hot Water No Wireless In Room "Night Manager", Daniel Davila , Not On Site Or Available Irene M......, Front Desk Was Courteous, Kind, And Tried To Do Her Best To Help. Bell Staff, When Asked To Help With Luggage Replied," You Look Strong Enough, Do It Yourself" , And Refused to Help !

Reviews.Title: “REALLY USC?!!! (USC Owned and Operated)”
Reviews.Author: LilOMe46
Reviews.Content: Deepal Jayasooriya, Director of Operations....REALLY????? No Water Pressure, No Hot Water, No CNN or Other Desirable TV Stations, No WIFI, PLENTY OF BEDBUGS....UCK! The Toilet Paper claims to be 1-Ply seems like 1/2-Ply. to me! USC should be embarrassed and ashamed! Welcome to the TROJAN Family! Personally I would offer my family members better.

Reviews.Title: “Hungry on Sunday? Too bad.”
Reviews.Author: MisterP723
Reviews.Content: Went down Sunday to eat breakfast and was told the restaurant was closed. The front desk clerk went on to explain that the hotel, which is owned by USC, operates under the University dining policy since several floors are used by USC as dorm rooms. All the dining halls on campus are closed on Sundays, and the University has extended this policy to the hotel. The ONLY reason to stay at this hotel is its proximity to the University, which needs to get out of the hotel business. That Radisson Hotels would allow its name to be attached to this property is beyond me.

Reviews.Title: “Pet Friendly”
Reviews.Author: ZSO
Reviews.Content: Only reason staying here is convenience to USC campus. So called "Executive suite" My room was pet-ready because here was dog food leftover on the floor of my closet and resting in the closet door tracks. The iron board had dry-rotted foam beneath the cover that kept falling to the floor whenever it was opened. The hair dryer bracket was ripped off the wall. The staff was inattentive with the front desk being unmanned for about 10 minutes in the morning (when people typically check out).

Reviews.Title: “Poorly run hotel”
Reviews.Author: cgarrett101
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my son and husband while we visited USC. The location is wonderful: right across the street from USC. Unfortunately, The front desk was generally unhelpful and the attitude was less than positive. There is no wifi, and when I used the Ethernet cable and attempted to download a movie on my computer, it took approximately 16 hours. There were no movies, or movie channels and the television was of poor quality. When I returned to the room in the late afternoon the privacy sign I had slid under the door when I left at 11:30 am was on the outside doorknob. At first I assumed the housekeeper had put it there after cleaning the room. However, when I entered the room there was a note from the housekeeper slid under the door which said the room was not cleaned because the privacy sign was on the doorknob. However, the privacy sign I had slid under the door upon my departure was nowhere to be found. The Housekeeping Manager was cooperative, however, the beds were comfortable and the rooms clean.

Reviews.Title: “Uninviting Front Desk, Clean but old rooms”
Reviews.Author: lani54
Reviews.Content: Stayed there over the weekend and at check in the front desk didn't even greet us until we were up in their face and every time we walked through the lobby no one would even look up from what they were doing...most of them were on their cell phones. Obviously they do not know the meaning of customer service and should all be retrained or seek new professions. Maybe they should all take lessons from the guy who worked the pizza place down the street. He was very friendly and courtous even though we walked in 10 min before closing. Rooms were old but clean. I could see they were renovating the lobby so maybe the rooms are next. I do not recommend this hotel unless you are a USC student.

Reviews.Title: “Closet Hotel to USC Campus”
Reviews.Author: daisygirl59
Reviews.Content: The headline says it all. The main reason to stay here is if you have business at USC, in our case orientation for an incoming freshman. I was prepared for a pretty bad experience based on previous reviews and was pleasantly surprised that the stay turned out to be average, not extraordinary and not horrible. Our room had a lovely view of the freeway and a construction site, but the traffic noise was not bothersome thanks to heavy curtains. TV worked, Internet worked, though you had to use a cable rather than Wi-fi. We did not eat in the hotel restaurant and frankly I could never quite figure out where it was. Staff were helpful and kept their promise to call me as soon as our room was ready - we had arrived very early in the day. There's a gift shop in the lobby with a very unfriendly woman tending it and charging high prices for bottled water and soda. And there's USC, right across the street - very, very convenient. That's the selling point for this establishment.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay unless you want to be close to USC”
Reviews.Author: goodolympian
Reviews.Content: A rather disappointing Radisson. 3-star. Pros: 1. Close to USC 2. good staff 3. Free internet 4. roomy showers Cons: 1. Dirty 2. Old 3. About 3 floors are university undergrad dorm! really, it is a student dorm. 4. Noisy 5. Overpriced 6. Our stay came with breakfast, disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for USC, but don't stay here unless you have to!”
Reviews.Author: Chenheart
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel as we were participating in a Cancer Walk adjacent to the USC campus and wanted a close hotel. The good thing was, we were able to park in the hotel lot the day of the event, which was great, as street parking is near impossible on event day. The bad? Well, the hotel is O-L-D old! Not quaint old, not charming old, just old-old! The worst part was the filthy elevator carpets...walking cesspools! We did not know that this was more of a USC dorm than a hotel~ thankfully, though crowded, the noise level was non-existant. This may, however, have had more to do with our rooms location ( next to last room at the furthest end of the hallway) than the acoustics. The pool/spa were being renovated which was too bad, as our weary feet/bodies would have loved a swim after the event, alas no! McKays restaurant and bar was great, however! Wonderful cocktails and the entrees were beautifully presented and delicious. We sat at the bar for dinner ( one of the best seats in any restaurant, in our opinion) and the bartender and other patrons were friendly and fun to be with. We saw that there was in-room dining, but no card to fill out and hang on the door, We found out that one has to call at 6:30 in the AM and order and wait for room service~ that was not at all what we wanted to do as we had to be at our event by 7:30 AM and thus had no "margin for error". We did eat an early , good breakfast at Mckay's~ I must say the coffee is FABULOUS! Rich, dark, flavorful~ a great change from the weak, see-through coffee one often finds in hotels. As for the Sleep Number beds?? If we had one, I wasn't aware of it~ and judging from the reviews, it seems we were not missing a thing! So perhaps that's a blessing! :-) The hotel served its purpose; sadly, thougtthe restaurant was great and the staff was friendly and accommodating I would not stay here again UNLESS it was for a quick, convenient overnight to attend a close-by event. Absolutely not a relaxing, hang-out, vacation type hotel. Had we been there for vacation, I would have been sorely disappointed, and perhaps would have cancelled our stay for any subsequent nights.

Reviews.Title: “Good for USC Visits -- Little Else”
Reviews.Author: CaliforniaDaveS
Reviews.Content: This hotel is part USC dorm, part hotel. It has a faded, worn out feeling. Our room was good sized, but dark and seemingly threadbare. It featured some sort of adjustable bed that was supposed to regulate the bed's firmness, but I'll omit the description of my heroic efforts to make it work, and just note that it didn't. We were honored with a first floor room next to the fitness center (itself kind of threadbare) which allowed us to experience the rich sounds of foot traffic all night. No hotel is better located for USC if you're visiting there (as I was). Other than that, I don't know why anyone would check in.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here for business trips”
Reviews.Author: aldiviva
Reviews.Content: My low overall rating reflects not the cleanliness of the room but three persistence difficulties--one with excessive noise (most other guests were under 18 and partied all night); one with the lack of email ($5/10 minutes on a system so slow that ten minutes was not adequate to download a single message); and one with a phone message system that had been blocked for the past nine months! I'm still getting emails from people who were unable to reach me and could only leave a message for last May's guest! It is also a long walk to food services other than the airless, noisy hotel bar and restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Not what we had hoped for.”
Reviews.Author: Anrmd
Reviews.Content: Sorry I did not read the TA reviews prior to spending over $220 to spend one night here.The main hook is it's across the street proximity to USC (the purpose of our stay). The hotel is not owned by the university but houses many USC students in a dorm like set up. Hallways, pool,etc with lots of students.The hotel is markedly outdated, has noise issues (students living there and street), and needs a major interior renovation. The Sleep Number Beds were not comfortable (each person can select there own level of discomfort) and feel like you are sleeping on an air mattress. Water presure in the shower was not great and the bathroom looked like it was out of the late 60's (yes, I'm old enough to remember!). Continental breakfast at McKay's had less appeal and variety than many other hotels which charge considerably less for their rooms. I would have never included it in my room rate had I known. We had a juice and coffee then left for breakfast elsewhere. The hotel staff was pleasant and I didn't even bother to complain because I figured it was my own fault for not doing my homework better. If you have to stay across the street from USC then ok, otherwise, you can do better elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “don't stay here”
Reviews.Author: mdr1215
Reviews.Content: Bad managment......needs to be replaced....I canceled my reservations with them and they still charged me a nite stay....talked to management they did not know what happened...no I am sorry for taking 300.00 out of my family's savings account...acted like it wasn't thier fault....a week latter still waiting on my money.

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: MunichAnthony
Reviews.Content: Just the dirtiest carpet I ever saw. A real multi-coloured yawn. And the room itself not much better. Breakfast only served in the cafe next door, slowest service in town. Never again.

Reviews.Title: “A few issues”
Reviews.Author: blondie7997
Reviews.Content: Well, it boosts that the rooms has sleep number beds, but ours did not. The sheets and bedspread where so old you could nearly see through them. The room was dirty, it truly needs to be deep cleaned. Be aware that if you park in the ramp and there is a game going on at USC you could come home with no place to park. Also the front desk was not very good at keeping our faxes from getting lost, so that was a huge pain. Room service got my order wrong, but did correct it after I complained, food is gross by the way. The night manager walks around with a smug look on his face and is truly the most unfriendly, rude person I have had to deal with in L.A. The reason you get a good deal on this room is because it sucks, but if you just need a place to sleep while in L.A. it is ok. But don't expect anything more then below average. I think it's a shame that it is a Radisson and it is such a DUMP. Also, half of the hotel faces the parking garage so your view is trash and you hear cars and car alarms all the time.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient to USC: No other reason to stay here”
Reviews.Author: Isky
Reviews.Content: This hotel is directly across the street from USC and convenient for our meeting there. Other than the location, I would not recommend this hotel. We had an even numbered room and heard traffic all day and night. The windows are NOT soundproof. The lower floors are overflow dorms for USC students so I was not surprised when students with backpacks and skateboards were on the elevator with me. Crumbs were under my desk and I told housekeeping, but nothing was done during my two night stay. The towels are very thin, the bathroom is tiny, the wallpaper was damaged and there was no vending machine. The upside: There were bathrobes in the closet, a cobb salad from room service was very good, two purified water bottles were provided every day and there was a small fridge in the room. The staff was very nice. If you stay here, ask for the executive king room on the 11th floor where the executive lounge has a free continental breakfast. We stayed on the 10th floor and had to take the elevator up one level everyday for free coffee. You will need your key card to go to any floor on the elevator. The business center is inside the gift shop where there are two computers and a printer. The internet is $5 for 30 minutes. The Sizzler restaurant is next door and even though it looks like a dump, they have an excellent salad bar. Also, downtown has two Macy's and a cab ride there is $10 one way. A taxi ride to LAX from this hotel is about $45.

Reviews.Title: “Weak”
Reviews.Author: TootieRed
Reviews.Content: All I can say is this is a good place to rest your head. We stayed 2 nights during the Bruce Springsteen concert in late Oct. We live north of LA, but due to work did not want to deal with the traffic of driving home and chose to stay close to LA Sports Arena. I called it the best self service- full service hotel. We went to the bar / restaurant each night and saw a total of 4 people waiting on 70 customers or more. The 2nd night we waited 45 minutes for our check and eventually walked out. Our room was dirty and carpet stained. The "free" breakfast was not even ready at 6:30 as advertised. Even though my hubby complained, no one took any ownership of the issues. I was to receive a call from the mgr and never did. Stay here if you are desparate for a 2 star hotel next to the arena.....other than that. book somewhere else. This place is total crap and the serivice was horrible.

Reviews.Title: “Too quiet.”
Reviews.Author: originalwong
Reviews.Content: Went for a business trip (I'm from Canada) and was a little startled to say the least. My american colleague told me afterwards that it was a mistake to book in this hotel (more because of the area than the actual hotel itself). However, the hotel and restaurant were entirely too quiet for my liking. Not sure if it was off season, but restaurant was quite large with only two dinner guests at the time (more staff than guests). Seemed like the entire hotel was empty (in a creepy sort of way). I would not have stayed if not for the business trip (and I will be certain not to stay again and look for other accomodations elsewhere closer to downtown LA).

Reviews.Title: “Great time at a Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dsnyduchess
Reviews.Content: I just stayed at the Radisson across from USC for a football game and I have to say that after reading some of the reviews of this hotel I was very skeptical but I was really pleasantly surprised to find the hotel was not only in a great location but the lobby was clean, there were even fresh flower arrangements throughout making for a lovely smell as soon as you walked in the doors. The front desk staff was friendly, everyone was wearing USC stuff so it was great to see the staff as excited as me and my friends were about the game!!!!! Go Trojans! As far as the room itself, it was pretty nice, you could tell the hotel is a little older and in need of some love but for the price and location it was just what we needed. The bed was comfy and the shower was fine. We didn’t use the internet or any business services so I can’t comment on that. But the food and sports bar were great! It was definitely was place to be after the game. Lots of USC fans celebrating which was really fun. All and all I have to say that this hotel must have gone through some changes since a lot of these past reviews were written. I had a great experience and this hotel and would absolutely stay there again for the next football game!

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Awful”
Reviews.Author: Andrea007
Reviews.Content: While the location was very handy to USC, the museums, rose garden, and the downtown area, the room itself was pretty awful. The sleep number beds were really uncomfortable no matter what setting you had them on. The bathrooms were disgusting. There was mold/mildew all over the grout on the floor. The shower was chipped, had peeling paint/caulking and poor water pressure. The towels were dingy and had ragged edges. The entrance to the parking structure is in a very unhandy location that causes you to have to drive around the block when approaching from the east. On a positive note, the staff was efficient and friendly, especially the gentleman running the continental breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Comfortable and friendly”
Reviews.Author: ragalligan
Reviews.Content: Spent 2 days in meetings. The banquet food and service was creatively done and tasty. The bartenders had personality and the room was clean and comfortable. Very convenient with USC just across the street. Fun Gift Shop if you are a USC fan!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel- Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: Dave2Dara
Reviews.Content: The hotel was nice and comfortable. Front Desk Service was great and the staff in the restaurant was great. The hotel was clean. Food was great- was there for a meeting.

Reviews.Title: “Don't book a room at the Radisson Midtown Los Angeles”
Reviews.Author: Camie41
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Radisson Midtown Los Angeles during the NCAA Woman's Basketball Games. I have to say it was the worse place I have ever stayed. I thought for sure the Radisson would have better rooms, food and customer service. We were treated poorly by the evening manager. The phones were out you could'nt call for room service we had to use the front lobby phone to have room service bring us a hamburger which was really bad. The layout of the bathroom has a lot to be desired, taking a shower was like stepping up on stage, God for bid if you were to fall and break your neck. The toilet is right in the center of the bathroom and you can't get around it and there Sleep One bed has got to go we did'nt get any sleep and the called this a Deluxe Guest Room for $169.00. Please!!!!!! Los Angeles Ca

Reviews.Title: “Service Good, Hotel Room average”
Reviews.Author: LovetotravelCalgary
Reviews.Content: Negative: Being living in Canada, I travel a lot and stayed at different Hotels. Thinking staying downtown LA at Radisson would be nice, but that was not the case. I had a executive room upgrade on the 10th flr and it did not feel like an upgrade at all. The bathtub felt like a stage and you get into it and after a shower, my husband almost fell stepping out of it. As for the toliet, it's impossible to use it with the bathroom door in the way of the toliet. Even when the door is closed, your face seems to be right against the back of the door. The AC was so loud and impossible to regulate the room temperature with it. Even after we left on the 4th day, no matter how we tweek the settings, temperature was never in the "just right" zone. The pillows looked fluffy, but once you sleep on it, it's dead flat. Sore necks is what we got after this trip. There were so many students in and out of the hotel, over the long weekend when were there, my husband tells me it feels more like a dorm than a hotel from the 9th floor down. To pay $169 for one night is not worth it at all, the value is not there. --- What kind of a executive room is this? Positve: Hotel staff were very polite and helpful with directions, that was the only good part I remembered.

Reviews.Title: “This is the First hotel on Trip Advisor that I gave a terrible rating to...”
Reviews.Author: s25843
Reviews.Content: Let me start off by saying that I am a Hilton Honors Gold VIP member, and a Starwood Preferred Guest Gold Member. I usually spend about 15-20 nights a year in hotels. I also do not provide room numbers in reviews for privacy reasons, if you would like the room number, please email me. I choose this hotel because I had some business to do in downtown LA, and since I had a gift certificate to a Radission (that Radisson gave me as a result of a previous problem at another property) I choose this hotel since it was the closest Radisson to downtown LA. This is a direct qoute off the hotel's website: "The spacious 240 newly remodeled rooms include 14 lanais (junior suite) plus 5 beautiful appointed suites. Like a jewel, everything sparkles.", the website also states the hotel has High Speed internet. This is the first hotel that I have reviewed on Trip Advisor (Out of around 15) that I gave lower than a 3 circle rating to. I arrived via a shared-ride shuttle from LAX, and not a single bell-person offered to help me with my bags, even though there were 2 employees sitting at the bell desk right next to the hotel's entrance. Room: I checked-in, and the agent asked another employee if the room was ready, I thought this as normal, and brushed it off. When I arrived at the room, it was old, musty, hot, and had a horrible smoke odor (the hotel is supposed to be 100% non smoking). I left my bags in the room and went back to the check-in desk. A different agent assigned me a new room on the same floor. The new room was better, but definately was not rennovated, and had several sticky stains on the carpet. The rooms are old, and the bathrooms are small, with old gross toilets, and odd tubs that are atleast 2 feet off the floor. There is even a sign in the bathroom warning to use the handrail when getting in and out of the tub. There was also no high speed internet as advertised on Radisson's website. Service: As I Said before, service was horrible, besides doing the basics of check-in and check-out. Location: This hotel is right on the main USC campus, and is also within walking distance from the Shrine Auditorium, besides that, there is really not much in the area. Dining: Since there is hardly anything in the area, I ordered room service. The 6" pizza for $6.95 was horrible and had a bad taste and the french fries had a horrible aftertaste. I would not recommend ordering from any of the on-site resturants at all costs. Misc: As other reviews have noted, the first 5 floors of this hotel double as a USC student dorm, which would have been nice if guests were warned of this before checking in. I would NOT stay in this hotel again, nor do I NOT recommend this hotel to anyone. It should be closed and de-listed as a Radisson property.

Reviews.Title: “This is a student dorm”
Reviews.Author: gemini68
Reviews.Content: This hotel doubles as a USC student dorm. Unless that appeals to you- stay away! The food was awful. The shower ran hot then cold, with no comfortable in between. The bed was horribly uncomfortable. The staff was helpful and friendly, but neither helpful nor friendly enough to convince me to return. Unless you only want to see USC, rent a car.

Reviews.Title: “April Fool's to stay here”
Reviews.Author: BinocularBob
Reviews.Content: A hotel is a bed and a shower away from home. These are the basics. They fail miserably in both of these categories. No comfort in an old bed with sheets that did not fit the bed. The pillows were very hard. We tried to control the heat in a cold drafty room. It was either too hot or we had to turn it off. The shower was very strange. You had to take a big step up to get in, where you stood above the water flow? There was no way to control the temperature. It fluctuated from warm, cold, very hot...cold, and this was without touching the dial. By the way, this was not unique to our room. We got two rooms for four guests. We had plenty to talk about at lunch. The same war stories. Towels that were so thin, they looked like they were stolen from a downtown gym. Needless to say, we did not get a good nights rest, we were all aching from a bad nights stay. The only benefit was it's a close walk to USC.

Reviews.Title: “Consistently Terrible”
Reviews.Author: dcdude
Reviews.Content: As an alumnus of USC who returns to cheer on the football team, I have stayed at this Radisson hotel (directly across the street from USC) many, many times through the years. Every time, I am consistently disappointed. In short, the hotel is a joke. The rooms are in bad shape -- have never been updated since the hotel was built...I'm guessing cica 1980? Service is terrible. Food is terrible. The hotel is simply 'terrible' in every way. The only reason to stay here is if a) you need to stay literally across the street from USC or b) you know that you'll be so drunk at the football game that you need to be able to "stumble to your room." Otherwise, stay away.

HotelInfo.Name: Radisson Midtown at USC
HotelInfo.Address: 3540 S Figueroa St, Los Angeles, CA 90007
